Arguably the best sequel ever made, The Godfather: Part II tells two tales: the beginnings of Don Vito Corleone's (Robert De Niro) life and career in the mafia, and the rise of Vito's son, Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) as he takes over the family business. Beautifully shot and intricately scripted, the two stories are symmetrical in plot and equally engaging. Godfather II was honored with six Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Director, Best Supporting Actor (De Niro), Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Art Direction, and Best Score. Notably, it's the only sequel in Oscar history to win the Best Picture honor.
